704471f-a.title: Brooklyn: Fulton Street - Furman Street
704471f-a.text:
Fulton Street, at the N.W. curner of Furman Street.
A view of the Brooklyn City Flour Mills, owned by Jewell
Brotners, who nrganized the Jewell Milling Company in
1880. (This site no longer serves as a mill in 1908).
On the opposite corner (S.A.), was a railroad terminus
for passengors from and to New York. The Brooklyn Bridge
was still under construction.
About 1880 7
Eugne L. Armbruster Cellection
4
SC'
704471f-a.folder: Fulton Street & Furman Street, Brooklyn, NY

704588f-a.title: Brooklyn: Furman Street - Fulton Street
704588f-a.text:
Furman Street, north side, between Fulten and Water Streets, showing
the fermer Fulton Street Ferry House, still standing in 1929.
July 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
704588f-a.folder: Furman Street & Fulton Street, Brooklyn, NY

704589f-b.title: Brooklyn: Furman Street - Fulton Street
704589f-b.text:
(1)
Furman Street, north side, between Fulton and Water Streets, shos.
ing the former Fulten Ferry house; rased in October 1926.
July 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Cellection.
(2)
The same, seen leoking westward.
July 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Cellection.

707326f-a.title: Brooklyn: Water St. - Fulton St.
707326f-a.text:
Vater Street, north side, between Fulton (left), and New Dock Streets
(right). In the background, is seen the Manhattan Fridge.
February S, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
